#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Think of a Username
#Text=When you are creating a new account on the Internet
#Text=it is important to not only think of an original username , but one that is memorable as well .
#Text=There are a few simple tricks to creating a unique username , like adding numbers and symbols , but creating a memorable one is entirely up to you .
#Text=Here are a few tips to creating the perfect username for your online accounts .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Identifying an Appropriate Username
#Text=Recognize what kind of username your are creating .
#Text=In a lot of cases , your username only appears to you as the account holder .

#Text=However , if you are creating an account on an online forum , a shared account , or are creating a username in a work environment , it is important to remember that the other users in your community will be able to see your username .
#Text=Do n't make it too complicated .
#Text=While a complicated username can be great for privacy reasons , it is important to remember that you will most likely need to recall this information on a regular basis .
#Text=Recognize the site 's specifications .
#Text=Some websites require your username to meet specific guidelines , like a capital letter and at least two instances of numbers or symbols .
#Text=Make sure you meet these requirements when designing your username .
#Text=Understand that you may have this username for a long time .
#Text=It is incredibly important to make sure that your username will be appropriate in the future because you may be using it for a long time .
#Text=For instance , a username that you find appropriate as a student or young adult may not be appropriate when you enter the workforce .
#Text=Avoid using too much personal information .
#Text=In a lot of situations it is important to maintain anonymity , especially when posting to forums and comment sections on the internet .
#Text=You probably do n't want that comment you left on YouTube to lead to someone messaging you through Facebook !
#Text=Thinking of a Unique Username
#Text=Think of something unique to you .
#Text=It often helps to think of a unique characteristic about yourself , like your eye color or a particular passion you may have .
#Text=This does not mean the last four digits of your Social Security Number !
#Text=Be vague !
#Text=A good example may be " GreenEyedBiker " if you love to bike and have green eyes .
#Text=Keep it simple .
#Text=If you are creating an account at your school or business , sometimes it is best just to keep it simple by making your username your first initial and your last name .
#Text=For example , if your name was Jane Smith , you could use " jsmith . "
#Text=To make this name more unique , add your middle initial or a number that bears significance to you .
#Text=Add numbers or symbols .
#Text=A great way to make your username more unique is to add numbers and symbols in the place of more complicated names .
#Text=For instance , you can jazz up " jsmith " by turning it into " j_smith35 . "
#Text=This is also a simple way to get that username you initially wanted but you were told that name has already been taken .
#Text=Tips
#Text=If you do decide to include a number in your name , do n't make it too complicated !
#Text=You do n't want to forget it .
#Text=Write down your username somewhere safe and nearby incase you forget it and need it for reference .
#Text=f you find that you ca n't seem to think of a unique and secure username , there are some username generators out there .
#Text=However , be careful when doing this as this could be an easy way for your information to be stolen .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Be sure not to put anything too personal in your username .
#Text=You do n't want strangers on the site you are on seeing your name or birth date .
